message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
Database db = session.getDatabase("","C:\\Projects\\NotesToJava\\sample.nsf");
DocumentCollection dc = db.getAllDocuments();
Document doc = dc.getFirstDocument();
while (doc != null) {
    RichTextItem body = (RichTextItem) doc.getFirstItem("Body");
    Vector v = body.getEmbeddedObjects();
    Enumeration e = v.elements();
    while(e.hasMoreElements()){
        EmbeddedObject eo = (EmbeddedObject)e.nextElement();
        if (eo.getType() == EmbeddedObject.EMBED_ATTACHMENT){
            System.out.println("Found attachment: " + eo.getName());
        }
    }
    doc = dc.getNextDocument();
}
<<<explanation>>>: Instead of trying to get a specific attachment by name, you can get all attachments by getting all embedded objects from the RichTextItem and checking if they are of type EMBED_ATTACHMENT. This way, you will get all attachments regardless of their names.
